greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) is the number of nonnegative walks of n steps with step sizes 1 and 2, starting at 0 and ending at k
comment: Equivalently, the number of paths from (0,0) to (n,k) using steps of the form (1,2),(1,1),(1,-1) or (1,-2) and staying on or above the x-axis.
It appears that A047002 gives the row sums of this triangle.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10200
maple: if k < 0 or k > 2*n then return 0 fi;
xref: Cf. A005408(row lengths), A047002(apparently row sums).
results.author: _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Mar 10 2011
